title: Stranger Foods
description: A catalogue of recipes Tom has made.

items.title: Pork katsu stir-fry
items.content_html:
Pork katsu stir-fry



Katsu curry sauce adds a tangy Japanese twist to this stir-fry. Pork loin steaks are a lean source of protein but could be swapped for thinly sliced chicken breast fillets if you prefer

items.title: Ultimate traybake ragu
items.content_html:
Ultimate traybake ragu



The plant-based ragu to end all others: this recipe delivers an incredible punch of umami flavour that will satisfy vegans and meat-eaters alike. It also happens to be extremely easy to throw together, and can be served with pasta or used as the base for a lasagne or shepherd's pie.

items.title: Kimchi-brined fried chicken sandwich
items.content_html:
Kimchi-brined fried chicken sandwich



A kimchi-and-buttermilk brine tenderizes and seasons chicken thighs, which are then fried until they're super crisp and stacked on a tender toasted bun or a flaky and buttery homemade biscuit.

items.title: Fish tagine with preserved lemon and mint
items.content_html:
Fish tagine with preserved lemon and mint



The fish tagines of coastal Morocco are often made with whole fish, or with large chunks of fleshy fish such as sea bass, monkfish and cod. The fish is first marinated in the classic chermoula flavouring, and the dish is given an additional fillip with white wine of sherry. Serve with new potatoes and a leafy salad.
